Let's take a moment to appreciate the backbone of our economy: small businesses. You know, those cozy coffee shops, quirky boutiques, and family-owned restaurants that give our neighborhoods character and charm. üè†‚òïÔ∏è

Did you know that small businesses account for a whopping 99.9% of all American businesses? Yep, that's right. These businesses employ 61.7 million Americans, which is 46.4% of private sector employees.

But it's not all rainbows and unicorns for these businesses. A staggering 90% of small business owners aren't confident that they're adequately insured. And, get this, 96% of them don't even know the basics about small business insurance. That's like trying to bake a cake without knowing what flour is! üéÇ

Small businesses are more than just numbers and statistics. They're the heart and soul of our communities. They're where we celebrate birthdays, have weekend brunches, and find that perfect gift for a loved one. They're also the places that know our names, our usual orders, and our stories.

Despite the challenges, small businesses continue to thrive and adapt. They're resilient, innovative, and full of passion. So, the next time you walk past a small business, pop in, say hi, and show some love. Because every purchase, every review, and every word of encouragement makes a difference.
